com.miviclin.droidengine2d

Class Engine

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.miviclin.droidengine2d.Engine

  • public class Engine
extends java.lang.Object
    Engine manages the game thread and the rendering thread.

    WARNING: onPause(), onResume() and onDestroy() should be called from Activity.onPause(), Activity.onResume() and Activity.onDestroy() respectively. DroidEngine2D uses OpenGL ES 2.0, so a compatibility check should be performed. For example: 
     
 Engine engine;
 if (ActivityUtilities.detectOpenGLES20(activity)) {
     engine = new Engine(...);
 } else {
     // Tell the user that his/her device does not support OpenGL ES 2.0
 }
    Author:
    Miguel Vicente Linares

      EngineBuilder is used to build the Engine.

      • getGame

      • getGLView

        public GLView getGLView()
        Returns the GLView.
        Returns:
        GLView

      • setGLView

        public void setGLView(GLView glView)
        Sets a new GLView. Also sets the GLRenderer to the new GLView and starts the GL thread.
        Calling this method manually when the Engine is first created is not needed.
        Parameters:
        glView - New GLView

      • startGame

        public void startGame()
        Starts the game thread and the rendering thread.

      • onPause

        public void onPause()
        Pauses the game thread and the rendering thread.
        This method should be called from Activity.onPause()

      • onResume

        public void onResume()
        Resumes the game thread and the rendering thread.
        This method should be called from Activity.onResume()

      • onDestroy

        public void onDestroy()
        Destroys the game thread and releases resources.
        This method should be called from Activity.onDestroy()
